result.execSummary:
The defendant Harley Dean Stands was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
26 days credit only if revoked.

Huber and good time available - community service under 973.03(3)
Defendant is to follow all rules of the Department of Corrections.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count 1 with no additional community service hours.
Concurrent with: Count 1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harley Dean Stands

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Harley Dean Stands in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:16 PM. Also called 15CT26. State - here for PLEAS on both matters - 15CT26 - amended to violation of DC with motor vehicle with a fine of $500.00 plus costs. Joy - 15CM150 - plead to both counts as alleged, imposed and stayed on each count, consecutive to each other, #1 - 90 day sentence and #2 - 9 month sentence, stayed and placed on probation for 2 years with standard conditions plus 100 hours of community service. State and Stands agree. Court - 15CT26 - amends to county ordinance of DC with motor vehicle, pleads G, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs totalling $767.50, 60 DTP/CO. On 15CM150 - Stands pleads G to both counts as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Stands withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 90 days in FC jail, stayed, place in probation for 2 years with conditions of: no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, follow all rules of the Department of Corrections, 100 hours of community service (total), costs plus surcharge on each count - paid thru probation; count #2 - 9 months in FC jail - consecutive to count #1 if revoked - 26 days credit only if revoked - huber and good time available - community service under 973.03(3), stayed, place on probation for 2 years - concurrent to each other, with same conditons except no additional community service, submit DNA sample with expunction right given, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Harley Dean Stands in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:21 PM. Called 15CM150 and 15CT26. Joy no resolution and asks for JT to be set. Offer no longer stands. State reciets what the agreement was. Stand is rejecting the agreement. State requests 15CM150 to go first.  Jury trial scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harley Dean Stands in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:34 AM. Also called 15CT26. State - here for INIT on 15CM150 and AIA on 15CT26. Stands has complaints. Court asks the defendant why he does not have an attorney. Stands responds, tried contacting an attorney twice (Jeff Joy). Court reads charges and penalties on 15CM150. Stands understands charges and penalties. Recess at this point to try and contact Jeff Joy. State gives the defendant Jef Joy's cell phone number in Court. Recess at 9:38 AM. Recalled at 9:47 AM. Jeff Joy now appears via telephone for the defendant. Court reads charges and penalties and updates Joy on case and bonds. Joy has no objections to the conditions of bond or bond as it is set. Court continues bond as previously set. Joy pleads NG on all counts. Court accepts pleas and sets matters for FPT on 12/2/15 at 1:30 PM.
No consumption of alcohol. Not to enter any bar or tavern.
